questions.question: What is the determinant of the matrix [[1, 2],[3, 4]]
What is the transpose of the matrix [[1, 2, 3],[4, 5, 6]]

explanations.a: The transpose is obtained by swapping rows and columns.

questions.question: What is the adjoint of the matrix [[1, 2],[3, 4]]

explanations.a: The adjoint is the transpose of the cofactor matrix.For [[1, 2],[3, 4]] cofactor matrix is [[4, -3],[-2, 1]]

questions.question: What is the cofactor of element a11 in the matrix [[1, 2],[3, 4]]

explanations.b: The cofactor of a11 is the determinant of the submatrix obtained by deleting the first row and column, multiplied by (-1)^i+j . Here it's (-1)^1+1 .4 =4

questions.question: What is the minor of element a11 in the matrix [[1, 2],[3, 4]]

explanations.b: The minor is the determinant of the submatrix obtained by deleting the first row and column, which is 4

questions.question: What is the inverse of matrix [[1, 2],[3, 4]]

explanations.a: The inverse is 1/det(A). adj(A) .Here , det(A)=-2 and adj(A)=[[4, -2], [-3, 1]]

questions.question: Which of the following matrices can be diagonalized?

explanations.b: This matrix is already diagonal. Diagonalizable matrices must have enough linearly independent eigenvectors to form a basis.

questions.question: What is the trace of the matrix [[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6], [7, 8, 9]]

explanations.d: The trace is the sum of the diagonal elements: 1+5+9= 15

questions.question: Which matrix is in row echelon form?

explanations.c: In row echelon form, all non-zero rows are above any rows of all zeros, and each leading coefficient of a row is to the right of the leading coefficient of the row above it.

questions.question: What is the rank of the matrix [[1, 2],[3, 4]]

explanations.a: The second row is a multiple of the first row, so the matrix is of rank 1
